intro: Trichonema purpurascens var. uliginosum, commonly known as the bog moss, is a low-growing evergreen plant that thrives in wet, acidic environments. It belongs to the family Calyptraeaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant has small, acrophyllous leaves that are typically reddish or purplish in color, giving it its common name. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil in bog ecosystems and contributes to nutrient cycling. Trichonema purpurascens var. uliginosum is often found in peatlands and other moist, shaded habitats.
